info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 26 at 12:56PM EST until December 27 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of western North Carolina, including the following areas, Eastern Polk, Greater Rutherford, Henderson, Polk Mountains, Rutherford Mountains and Transylvania and upstate South Carolina, including the following areas, Central Greenville, Greater Pickens, Greenville Mountains, Northern Spartanburg and Pickens Mountains. * WHEN...Until 6 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Deep moisture across the area and strong southeasterly low level flow will lead to heavy rainfall tonight. Isolated to scattered thunderstorms are also possible which could increase rainfall rates where they develop. 2 to 4 inches of rain has already fallen with additional amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected through tonight. This could lead to flooding, especially locations along and near the Blue Ridge Escarpment where upslope flow could enhance rainfall rates. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on current forecasts. Please monitor the latest forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
